summary: The Youth Lead Act (HR 2812) proposes amending the Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 to provide grants to the Girl Scouts of the United States of America, the Boy Scouts of America, the National 4-H Council, and the National FFA Organization. These grants, totaling $5,000,000 annually from 2026 to 2030, are intended to establish pilot projects that expand the organizations' programs in rural areas and small towns. The bill was introduced in the House of Representatives on April 10, 2025.
